title: Lida93
author: Lida93
content: How will you rate the VAR officiating so far in the games that have been played in the Qatar 2022 world cup games.Going by the dramas on the pitch in the previous games, What could you decipher as the flaws and strength of the VAR in the previous games played?Where has the VAR gotten it wrong in certain decisions taken in this World Cup games?Share us your thoughts

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: I would rate it really good considering that yesterday night in the Argentina game we would not have a penalty for them without VAR,many people maybe do not agree with that penalty but it was a clear penalty to me as the goalkeeper of Poland clearly hit Messi face and that for me is a foul.I think in many other occasions VAR has given penalties that otherwise would not have been given so overall until now I am liking VAR and before the World Cup started I did not expect to see such performance from the VAR,I was not expecting to be that good but this is just what I think.

comments.author: boltz
comments.body: It's much better than we are used to see in UCL , right ? Because so far , I don't remember any controversy VAR decision in this World Cup and even the referees are doing a great job by keeping the games clean. Maybe next phase , we will bring more controversy to VAR but with next phases , we will have only top referees as well so I prefer to have a clean tournament when VAR is used only when is necessary.

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: So far, the VAR has been doing credibly well and are very fearful with their judgment due to some advanced technology being used by VAR officials which has made it very easy to make decisions as quickly as possible, and moreover, the referees have been officiating the matches well in this group stage, which I hope they will continue to do because it is a world tournament and FIFA are very strict with their rules.

comments.author: Bitinity
comments.body: Quote from: boltz on December 01, 2022, 08:06:29 AMIt's much better than we are used to see in UCL , right ? Because so far , I don't remember any controversy VAR decision in this World Cup and even the referees are doing a great job by keeping the games clean. Lets see some facts in the current World Cup that can be considered as debatable or controversy: 1. The ruled out goal by Ecuador in the opening match against Qatar. 2. Penalty given to Portugal against Ghana3. Penalty given to Argentina against Poland4. Ruled out goal by France (Griezman) against Tunisia. I think there are still some controversy/debatable decision due to VAR. In my honest opinion as what I've said few times about VAR, it kills the art of soccer game. Just simple example, a goal is ruled out because of offside for 1inch. I do even think that offside rules in soccer need to be revised.

comments.body: Quote from: Lida93 on December 01, 2022, 07:05:37 AMHow will you rate the VAR officiating so far in the games that have been played in the Qatar 2022 world cup games.Going by the dramas on the pitch in the previous games, What could you decipher as the flaws and strength of the VAR in the previous games played?Where has the VAR gotten it wrong in certain decisions taken in this World Cup games?Share us your thoughtsso far, many teams have been eliminated or lost because of VAR in this world cup, the presence of VAR especially in matches makes us feel like we are seeing robots playing, imo it's quite sad because we seem to have lost the art of football itself even though the match is getting fairer because Offside can be detected easily.

comments.author: safari88
comments.body: They certainly didn't do their job flawlessly. If the VAR intervenes, I think they should also make a decision on the spot what the referee should do. Now the referee is called aside and the referee has to make the decision himself. Wouldn't you make it much more logical if the VAR would also make the decision right away? Now the entire responsibility of the choice is placed on the umpire's shoes. But good decisions have also been made in themselves. Argentina's penalty yesterday was not a penalty, so that was strange. We are and will always be people who make mistakes.

comments.author: rahmad2nd
comments.body: VAR has been an integral part of football for the last five years. and, in fact we have discussed VAR in many threads. however, there is nothing wrong if we discuss VAR at this world cup in Qatar. and if I refer to the effectiveness of VAR in this world cup, it is clear that with VAR the world cup is much better and cleaner than the dramas that often occur on the football field. scandals such as match fixing and the like, can be wiped out with VAR technology.So far, VAR has made it easier for referees to make decisions when in doubt. and VAR, has worked as it should.at the world cup in Qatar, VAR received more attention from football fans. there was an incident that made some fans emotional because several goals were disallowed by the referee, but there were also those who benefited from VAR, including in our betting on this world cup. sometimes VAR is an advantage for us, for example in Tunisia and France matches. but there were also things that made us unprofitable, because several goals were annulled, such as the Argentina vs Saudi Arabia match.  but either way, the controversy will always remain.
